Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.3525, 0.0] Create the first face of the sketch and draw the following lines: - Line 1: Draw from [0.0, 0.0] to [0.7659, 0.0] - Line 2: Draw from [0.7659, 0.0] to [0.7659, 0.2678] - Line 3: Draw from [0.7659, 0.2678] to [0.2618, 0.2678] - Line 4: Draw from [0.2618, 0.2678] to [0.2618, 0.6497] - Line 5: Draw from [0.2618, 0.6497] to [0.0, 0.6497] - Line 6: Draw from [0.0, 0.6497] to [0.0, 0.0] Create a loop using the lines provided above. The loop is closed. Scale the 2D sketch by 0.7659. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch with the specified Euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model. The extrusion depth towards the normal is 0.3525, and the extrusion depth opposite the normal is 0.0. The sketch scale parameter for the sketch is 0.7659. For this operation, add materials to the current part and create a new solid body. The height, width, and length of this intermediate part are 0.7659, 0.3525, and 0.7659, respectively. The shape of the intermediate part is also a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a curved side. The prism is slightly tilted to the right.</description>
